text: Fernand Joseph Désiré Contandin was a French actor and singer. He is usually called Fernandel. He was born on 8 May 1903 in Marseille, France. He acted in comedies for vaudeville and operettas. He was best known for his role in the Don Camillo series of movies. His first Hollywood movie was Around the World in Eighty Days. Fernandel died 26 February 1971 from lung cancer. He is buried in the Cimetière de Passy, Paris, France. == References == == Other websites == * Category:1903 births Category:1971 deaths Category:Actors from Marseille Category:French comedians Category:French movie actors Category:French movie directors Category:French movie producers Category:French singers Category:Musicians from Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur
title: Fernandel
